uncc2014watsonsim.research

Class PassageScorer

  • java.lang.Object
    • uncc2014watsonsim.research.PassageScorer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Scorer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BingRank, ElliotMerschScorer, GoogleRank, IndriRank, IndriScore, IreneScorer, JM_Scorer, KensNLPScorer, LuceneRank, LuceneScore, NamedEntityRecognizerScorer, NGram, PassageQuestionLengthRatio, PassageTermMatch, PercentFilteredWordsInCommon, PercentWordsInCommon, QuestionInPassageScorer, ScorerAda, ScorerP, SentenceSimilarity, SkipBigram, StephensonScorer, WordProximity, WShalabyScorer

    public abstract class PassageScorer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Scorer
    Scorers apply scores in parallel to: - Answers - Passages By default, a score is NaN. Scorers are expected to run in parallel. Try to avoid side effects. Otherwise use "synchronized".

    • Method Detail

      • scoreQuestion

        public void scoreQuestion(Question q)
        Default implementation of research for a question. Calls research_answer for every Answer, collecting the mean, median, max and min of the results. Override this if you need more power.
        Specified by:
        scoreQuestion in interface Scorer
        Parameters:
        q - Question

      • scorePassage

        public double scorePassage(Question q,
                  Answer a,
                  Passage p)
        Default implementation for researching a passage. Does nothing by default. You don't need to override this if you don't use it.
        Parameters:
        q - Input Question, varies slowest
        a - Input Answer, varies medium
        p - Input Passage, varies fastest
